name: Derrick Wentworth
text: Great local shop. They have ethanol free fuel a bottle shop and a small deli. They are the perfect place to stop on your way to the lake.

name: Dana Farris
text: Very convenient, always clean and neat, good selection, good service, owners are very friendly and helpful as much as they can be. They have added more food they cook themselves. Great if your stopping by for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. They also have a package store with a great selection.

name: Tiffaney Shaw
text: Very clean store and extremely nice, hospitable owners.

name: BHUPENDRA PATyEL
text:
Nearest to dam...
Good tackle at good priced. ..
Good taste food

name: leah jones
text: Loved going to Decatur’s best bait shop! If your looking for a family ran shop don’t have any regrets make sure you stop in! Also, the only bait shop in Decatur that has live bait!

name: Justin Tomlinson
text:
Best lil hometown bait shop around
Some of the freshest bait you will find!! You will not regret stopping by at all!

name: Penn Philips
text: They have all your fishing needs!  Fast friendly service with a smile😁

name: Michael Kewl
text: The Industrial Park sited on Wheeler Lake's southern shores is the epicenter of the industrial pollution of Wheeler Lake by 3M where the PFOA/PFOS concentrations have been found to be the highest for the fish is adjacent to Jay's Landing area .

resp.text: The bait shop has no connection whatsoever with the plants or Jay Landings.  We are located on their property and the plants are near us, however, neither of the 2 affect the bait we sell or our business.  Thank you for the review.

name: Gary Holcombe
text: First class place

name: lismc715 Rolltideuser
text: They are closed!

name: G Bullard
text: Nice folks.  Good selection.  Takes pride in the product.

name: BIG MAC
text: I just love this place! The owner is so nice and helpful and has a great selection to fit any fishing need and then some.

name: Austin Herod
text: Great place to get just about everything

name: Jason Cheney
text:
Just a little place but I was  pleasantly surprised to see how well stocked they are with fishing gear. Lots of soft plastics. Happily they had the baits I was looking for. REALLY surprised they had the KVD 8.0 square bill! They've got live bait too; crickets & worms. Small selection of rods, reels, tackle boxes, etc
Unlike a lot of places out here in the sticks the do accept cards.
Went in for the fishing gear and didn't pay much attention to the rest of the stuff they carry. Though I did see some pellet guns, ammo, bino's and other outdoor stuff.

Nice to have a well stocked bait shop close to home.

name: martin eugene duke
text: Nice friendly person running this store. Great christian owned and operated business. People need to give these type of businesses their patronage.

name: Charles Reno
text: They are very friendly and had everything I wanted

name: Shon Burton
text: Love Gina's bait,tackle great place to buy all your fishing needs

name: Shianne rogers
text: Amazing lady.

name: Renea Martin
text: Nice place friendly people

name: Derek Sellers
text: I’ve been here before. The staff weren’t super knowledgeable. Today, I made the 30min round trip only to find the door locked. It’s 4:30pm, and the store says they close at 5:00pm. I called less than an hour ago to verify they had what I was looking for. This is so frustrating. I will never come here again.

name: Jennifer Boothe
text:
Love this place
..live bait  ! And helpful staff .super old school and my kinda people...if you like to fish check them out. There bait gets the big ones!

name: Jerry Gaston jr
text: Love going in the bait shop to get all my live bait and glad that the Legendary Bait Shop is back open lot of memories in that store when Larry was the owner so it feels good every time I walk back in there

name: Samantha Smith
text: The best place around to get fishing equipment! Wonderful people ❤

name: DAVID MURPHY
text: I hate to be the one to bring the bad news, but Mr Larry has passed away and I'm not sure his daughter is going to re open the store. What a great pair they were. Friendly to everyone who walked in the door and he was the best reel mechanic anywhere. Truly a landmark to the Bessemer area and a legend in the fishing community. From the sportsmen and women, our heart felt condolences and thanks for all the wonderful memories and service.

name: Maureen Wood
text: Does anyone out there remember Mr. Marion Betts and his wife?? I was the nurse in St. Petersburg, Fl who took care of them. I have never met finer people in my life and miss them to this day. Maureen Wood

name: karl chesser
text: The best and friendly place to buy live bait from crickets to minnows and more,, and reel repair can't be beat parts for reels no the spot most of the time,,Mr Larry is very knowledgeable when it comes to many types of reels been doing business with him for over 30 years.

name: Adam Sparks
text: One of the best places to shop at. . great people.. Great prices.

name: James H. Jackson
text: Very nice people and very helpful in finding everything you want and need just ask for Larry.👍

name: Jeremy Summerlin
text: I hate he passed away. Hope someone keeps the bait shop open if they can. God bless them.

name: Jerry Forman II
text: Been buying my baits and jig heads for years always has the best at the best price!!

name: Stephen Armstrong
text: Love it just wish the guy could get some more business

name: ERIC ALDRIDGE
text: One of the best and best stocked bait shops around!

name: Thomas Tolliver
text: Arrived at 4:30pm on Saturday and they were closed. Sign says open till 5pm. Also the phone is disconnected.

name: Shane Mccormick
text: Definitely a hidden gem in,Bessemer

name: Thomas Parish
text: I enjoyed talking way too long with the owner and his wife. They have lots of tackle, crickets, worms and minnows.

name: Crystal Fontes
text: I love this store ❤️ the owners are knowledgeable an willing to help you

name: Kyle King
text: Great people and they know alot about fishing

name: Beverly Roper
text: Adorable couple that run this place.  I definitely will be back

name: Michael Skeen
text: Down home hospitality,fine place to buy Bait. Minnows&redworms this time!

name: Himey Baker
text: A very nice mom and pop store. They sell live bait, fishing supplies, ice, snacks, drinks, and the most valuable thing..... The fishing locations.

name: Coco Brown
text: The owner is extremely rude me and other customers took our business elsewhere.

name: Donna Davis
text: Such a nice lady running this place. So helpful and sweet . I will definitely go there again .

name: W P
text: Only place around to get bass shiners, great little shop.

name: Daniel DiCenso
text: Thank you for helping me catch my first Largemouth!  You can't beat local knowledge.

name: Johnathan Mitchell
text: Closed at “night” not 7pm... Ruined my fishing trip!!

name: Clue Wyatt
text: Good selection knowledgeable clerks

name: mike pelton
text: Sold me some faulty reels and when I brought them back tried to say i damaged the reels. Said worms would last three weeks of kept in room temp, they died one day later. I would bypass this place if I had a choice.

name: Barry Gray
text: This place is awesome, they have a big variety of product and not to mention the fishing supplies. The people who work there are awesome as well and are very helpful!!

name: James Johnson
text: Very helpful staff. The best minnows around can take them out all day they last and still stay alive. Tackle shop is has everything you need convenience store is also great very friendly on

name: Jon Grigsby
text: Had what I needed, packed them in a bag topped with oxygen, still healthy when I got home. Glad I found this bait shop.

name: Nick Harbison
text: My go to for bait. Close to the house and friendly people work there

name: Shae Lambert
text:
we love the shiner shack!! ❤️❤️❤️
if you're looking for a place to get good food great service and an awesome selection of bait and tackle check them out!!
🐟🍕😊

name: Sandy Hollis
text: This place is a friendly store with quick customer service.  They serve hunts pizza and chicken.  They have nachos, cappuccino machine.  Fountain drinks if you don't want a bottled drink.  You can find petty much anything a convenient store carries that you might need.  Try them out.  Oh yes they also have a bait shop for your fishing needs of your going fishing on Smith lake.

name: Jay Belcher
text: Friendly staff, they always have what I need for a good day on the water. And the pizza is awesome.

name: Katrina Smith
text: Love this shop! Only place I’ll go!

name: Melena Estaine
text: Great management, wonderful workers. Fantastic cricket prices.

name: Connie Sparman
text: I drive 30 minutes just to get bait to go catfishing

name: Matt Hale
text: Made to order pizza

name: Catfish Cousin's
text:
After 5 a.m.  an not open
Time on the door says open at 5 a.m. on Sunday
Still waiting 5.10
No hurry I'm just going fishing
Thanks for nothing  you lose bout $40.00

resp.text: I’m terribly sorry I was running late this morning.  Good luck with your fishing trip.

name: Crystal Canada
text: Love the people and the pizzas are great

name: Heather Ray
text: Great selection!

name: William Hicks
text:
(Translated by Google) Mmmmmmmmmm pizza !!! 🍕

(Original)
Mmmmmmmmmm pizza!!! 🍕

name: Travis Engram
text: Awesome country store! Owner is great, I had a delicious sausage on a bun! Store has tons of essentials, bait/tackle, home repair, even CB radio equipment.

name: Suzanne Raupp
text: Good place to shop if you are camping and need a few items. Not a large variety of stock but the location is convenient and kind.

name: Pitbullblues The Gamer
text: I've gone to this place for 23 years so you can't doubt my opinions on this place. For one they don't sell cigarettes or alcohol so if that's all you're after try elsewhere. This place is owned and operated by kind Christians. They have about anything you could need if you can't make a trip to town and you need something on short notice. People might say they are a bit over priced but if you think about it this place is almost 20 miles from the closest city so price wise they are in the right. What this all boils down to is they're good people, with good service, good products, good prices, a good store, and good gas.

name: Justin Daugherty
text: This store has just about anything you need from food to CB equipment. Mr. Kite is a great and friendly guy too!!

name: Michael Knuckles
text: Ethanol free gas and dog food best price.

name: Daniel Speegle
text: Open 24-7 and has a variety of tasty snacks along with excellent service.

name: Jason Cropper
text: Great gas station always have a personal taste and really great people they always treat ya like family

name: KOFFIN nails
text: Terrible place. Not clean smells like old dirty mop water, incompetent workers, on the phone half the time or turns wrong pump on, and the number 1 thing, asked years ago after the owner sold it if they were going to fix the parking lot and it hasn't changed so seeing as they don't have handicap parking and it's impossible for a wheelchair to even roll on it i have filed a claim with the ADA seeing as they have more than 4 parking spots they are required to have one. 2 stars? Cause they have back up generators and open 24 hours. But I stopped going since Feb 2020

name: Nikkinz
text: They have the best biscuits around the area. They do seem to run out of some foods (sometimes bacon but everyday eggs) and dont really prepare more even if I come in at 7 a.m for breakfast every single day. The girls have been very polite up until recently and not quite sure why that's changed but it's made me feel unwelcomed and I guess I'll have to start going back to Jack's. The older ladies are always nice and polite and though I could understand if it was sporadic visits during the week but it's literally everyday that I come for breakfast and lunch. They have great coffee the best I've found in Cullman. Again though the attitudes have made my visits undesirable and I'll be going there less now.  Another example has been when I get wings or chicken strips or even a hamburger they dont ask if I want condiments that generally go with the food but they will ask everyone around me if they want sauce or lettuce and tomato??? I am in Cullman for work purposes and when I found this place it was like a little hole from home and I fell in love but that has since deteriorated a bit and will be visiting less. :(

name: Judy Moctezuma
text: The biscuits are the best! However it seems they have a set amount they cook every morning and always run out early.My opinion is they should cook more as they already know they run out and have to turn away so many wanting breakfast. Also the lunch food items are cooked the fast way either in a microwave or a oven and would taste much better if ( for example) egg rolls , pizza sticks, tater wedges were deep fried not cooked in a microwave. Also maybe add more variety of lunch menu items. Just little things could use improvement but over all it  is a great store and the owner will order things to sell in the store if a customer ask and it is in his power to do so.I had ask for a certain kind of liquid creamer and it is now sold there.🎉

name: Karen Patterson
text: I love that they are open 24 hrs. and keep a huge variety of food, snacks and hardware items. The stores shelves are always stocked and perfectly arranged and the entire store is always neat and clean no matter what time of day or night I stop in. Most of the cashiers are always friendly and courteous.

name: Michael Glasscock
text: Always nice, friendly service and staff. Great breakfast as well as their other food. I highly recommend this place to anyone. It’s a great hometown store.

name: Elizabeth McGraw
text: Never use your food stamp card there they will over charge you and won't put it back on your card or fix the problem

name: Daquari Bishop
text: Has the BEST 🥓 biscuits in Cullman!!!!! Everyone is so friendly especially that little hottie Emily  SHE ROCKS 🎸💯

name: Anita Brannan
text: Shop here daily. Employees friendly. I get 1-2 cups of ice everyday because I absolutely am hooked on the crushed ice. My only complaint is the fluctuating price of ice. While I agree with charging for the cup used to hold the ice, I dont think charging for frozen water is  not really necessary, seriously. I and my family are there EVERY day and spend a lot of .money so I think ice would be a nice gesture especially when  I'm furnishing the cup. Mrs. Ann doesn't like my being in so often for ice apparently and charges me .more than any other cashier because "the price has gone up".....  For ice that  I put in my cup. The only assistance I received was the cashier taking my money. Of course all of this is petty and I don't mind paying for this service, because they have the ice I like and want so its warranted for me. Would just appreciate a little more courtesy and less fluctuating prices.

resp.text: While no public business is perfect, we do strive to be. Thank you for letting us know where we have come short so that we can work on that issue. Thank You for your business

name: Joshua Thomas
text: great place , anything you need , you can get it here

name: Bruce Bentley
text: We have SNOW SLEADS come and get yours  before they’re gone. Limited quantities. Enjoy the snow.

name: Chris Kelso
text: The atm did not dispense my money due to being tied into phone line. So if you are getting money out to spend at that store..you will get screwed. I am a very loyal customer who will no longer go to this store. Clerk was very rude and acted like she could care less. Did not want to call the mananager. Acted like it was a big hassle to call him. I spend on average 180.00 a week on gas and about $50 a week on breakfast and drinks. I will let everyone know what a rip off this store is. I can see why you can't keep no help and it is a different person every two weeks.

name: Brandy Dingler
text: Love stopping threw on my way home or to work

name: Nick Nail
text: Has an Icee machine. 5 stars for that alone considering how hard they are to find.

name: cherokee price
text: Awesome crew, always polite and great friendly service. Love y'all

name: John Calloway
text: No Joey, Your Right!!! They Will Screw You Over Faster Than A Jack Rabbit On Speed!!!

resp.text: I dont know john or what problem he had , if i he had of contacted me it would have been made right.

name: Tracy Regelin
text: Well , the 3 star's are for the larger selection of food and snacks and household goods, it's similar to actual mini grocery store

name: Laura Bennett
text: Nice cashiers

name: Bruce
text: They have everything, friendly, clean, FREE WATER if you need it.

name: Matt Rasco
text: Great service

name: Jim Glimpse
text: Clean, bright, friendly & locally owned.

name: Joey Gill
text: I was traveling through.. my car was running hot needed​ water.. this place would not let me use the water hose.. so if you in a bind and need help like WATER look elsewhere.. not a friendly place..

name: Bruce Bentley
text: Thiis a response to the water hose response. I have never refused anyone water that needed it. I do keep the out side water locked because people were coming up here at night and stealing water from me. We have always helped anyone who ever needed help including water.

name: Eric Myers
text: The best lure money can buy! The manger takes great care of his customers!!! I’ll be back soon.

name: Gonzagafan
text: Please bring back the Dominator! At least a couple colors California 420, Black with Red flake and blue flake, Mossy mud and big texan

name: James Wright
text: Never been herr

name: Jim Brown
text: They are one of my clients!

name: Patsy E.
text: I had ordered worms from a worm farm but they were all dead when they arrived. I called Stoddard to see if they had worms because all of my grandchildren were expected to visit for the next week and we didn't have worms to fish with. She was running low that day but she was so nice and went above and beyond to help me find enough worms to get us through the week. They also had a nice variety of lures and tackle. Definitely recommend 👌.

name: Ila Austin
text: Small town feel with great prices. She sells big name and locally made tackle and other gear. Ask about live bait for fishing and feeder mice for snakes.

name: Angie Carter
text: A great place to buy all of your fishing equipment.

name: Nate O’Reilly
text: Last real bait shop left around here. Awesome place and been there a long time. Must go!!!

name: Tammy davis
text: Very friendly and helpful!! They had exactly what we needed.  We will be back again!!

name: Terry Lynn Jr
text: Great place with plenty of bait and tackle

name: Greg Gentry
text: Wonderful and quaint bait shop in downtown Wetumpka. Always have great bait and tackle in stock along with plenty of choices.

name: John Novak
text: Nice country feel

name: Danny Hatcher
text: Awesome ppl.always open (7days).And always has quality bait and great prices.

name: Chris Eubanks
text: Have a wide selection of items, this will be my new bait shop!

name: Jeremy Lynch
text: Live bait, like a trip back in time!!

name: felicia franklin
text: Small but good

name: ocie wright
text: I love this spot good price n good people

name: William Blakeney
text: We love this bait shop in the owner is one of the nicest people you'll ever meet!  - from Thomas and Seeley

name: Trey K
text: Forced to buy crappie minnows here again because of distance thought new ownership might make a difference but i was wrong they all died in the bucket before i made it to the lake for about the 5 th time ive had to buy from this place. I buy minnows at Lake Martin Bloom and Bait and they all stay alive for several days these wont even make it to the water. Dont know if they need to aerate better or what but the minnows i get that last for days always have blue water Stoddards is always clear.

name: Fred Smith
text: Great place for bait

name: Tyrone Smith
text: Great fishing tackle

name: Will Gump
text: Great selection with great people.

name: RC Collum
text: They are the last stop to a great fishing destination always very helpful and super nice

name: Martha Wyatt
text: Great selection in bait. Great cashier's. Clean

name: Albert Vickers
text: Had everything we needed for our fishing trip. Alot to choose from

name: alonza hughley
text: Nice place to get you some minnows and worms love stopping by the store sometime to grab a biscuit in the morning times people is real friendly

name: trumpsflood
text: The best convenience store pizza I have ever had. Nice staff also.

name: Sara Miller
text:
The ladies were extremely kind and helpful. Prices were reasonable too. Especially considering most convenient stores are usually over priced.
The store has changed so very much since the last time I was in there.  Granted it's been 20 years since I have been in the store.
This was the 1st time I have been to this store since I was a child. When I was a child we lived in Coosa County just passed the county bridge at a place called Sequoyah. Delilah Smithereman was my bis driver. We would have to wait at T&N to catch the bus sometimes.

name: John Long
text: Feels like home. Love you guys!

name: Christal Thompson
text: The clerk was so incredibly polite and helpful. Wide variety of bait and convenience store items. Liquor store and fireworks next door. Southern charm meets "Guts, God, & Glory", all in one place.

name: Tammy Cloer
text: Nice little country store

name: Jervorius Riley
text: I'm impressed to see a gas station in the area!!! Country as ALL get out, but I think it has 2 gas pumps total. One is broke, but still surprised it's there. Decent customer service, at least anyways. Outside bathroom, gave 3 stars because of 1 pump being broken.

name: Phillip Cleckler
text: Politeness

name: Robert Cleckler
text: A very good are let me rephrase that great down home Country Store who cares about their customers

name: Tony Benefield
text: I love'um and they love me 😂😂😥

name: Crystal Dawn
text: Nice

name: David Sneed
text: Great little country store.  Owned and operated by nice people.  Bait, beer,gas, and a little food.

name: Laurie Yoder
text: We always get out bait here on our way into Higgins Ferry camp ground. Really nice people.

name: Jeff Foster
text: Best minnows I've found

name: Sassy Sophia
text: Old fashioned store. With fishing and tackle supplies. This little store will take you back in time. Buy a bottle coke & pack of peanuts while your there!

name: Christy Hall
text: Great store gas station

name: Richard Newell
text: Great people very helpful

name: Greg Thrash
text: The owner is a complete ×××hole!!! They have high prices and capitalize on people in need.  Also.have personal knowledge she curses at customers and talks about their private struggles to anyone else who will listen.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!

name: Meghan Smitherman
text: My favorite store!

name: TIM Williams
text: Great for directions.

name: Grandville Anderson
text: Never been to this place

name: Kimberly Henderson
text: Great

name: Rachel Jackson
text: Great place!

name: Cw K
text: Friendly folks

name: Mike Hand
text: Got everything for a day on the water plus breakfast early in the morning.
